verses.verse: (A Psalm, a Song for the Sabbath day.) It is good <S%H2896><s%> to give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> And to sing <S%H2167><s%> praises <S%H2167><s%> to Thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O Most <S%H9411><s%> High; <S%H9411><s%>
To declare <S%H5046><s%> Thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> And Thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> by night, <S%H3915><s%>
With the ten-stringed lute, and with the harp; <S%H5035><s%> With resounding <S%H1902><s%> music <S%H1902><s%> upon the lyre. <S%H3658><s%>

For Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> hast made <S%H8055><s%> me glad <S%H8055><s%> by what <S%H6467><s%> Thou hast done, <S%H6467><s%> I will sing <S%H7442><s%> for joy <S%H7442><s%> at the works <S%H4639><s%> of Thy hands. <S%H3027><s%>
How <S%H4100><s%> great <S%H1431><s%> are Thy works, <S%H4639><s%> O Lord! <S%H3068><s%> Thy thoughts <S%H4284><s%> are very <S%H3966><s%> deep. <S%H6009><s%>

A senseless <S%H1198><s%> man <S%H376><s%> has <S%H3045><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> knowledge; <S%H3045><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> does a stupid <S%H3684><s%> man <S%H3684><s%> understand <S%H995><s%> this: <S%H384><s%>

That when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> sprouted <S%H6524><s%> up like <S%H3644><s%> grass, <S%H6212><s%> And all <S%H3605><s%> who did <S%H6466><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> flourished, <S%H6692><s%> It [was only] that they might be destroyed <S%H8045><s%> forevermore. <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5703><s%>
But Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> art on high <S%H4791><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>

For, behold, <S%H2009><s%> Thine enemies, <S%H340><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> For, behold, <S%H2009><s%> Thine enemies <S%H340><s%> will perish; All <S%H6><s%> who do <S%H3605><s%> iniquity <S%H6466><s%> will be scattered. <S%H205><s%>
But Thou hast exalted <S%H7311><s%> my horn <S%H7161><s%> like [that of] the wild <S%H7214><s%> ox; <S%H7214><s%> I have been anointed <S%H1101><s%> with fresh <S%H7488><s%> oil. <S%H8081><s%>

And my eye <S%H5869><s%> has looked <S%H5027><s%> [exultantly] upon my foes, <S%H7790><s%> My ears <S%H241><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> of the evildoers <S%H7489><s%> who rise <S%H6965><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> me.

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> man <S%H6662><s%> will flourish <S%H6524><s%> like the palm <S%H8558><s%> tree, <S%H8558><s%> He will grow <S%H7685><s%> like a cedar <S%H730><s%> in Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>
Planted <S%H8362><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> They will flourish <S%H6524><s%> in the courts <S%H2691><s%> of our God. <S%H430><s%>

They will still <S%H5750><s%> yield <S%H5107><s%> fruit <S%H5107><s%> in old <S%H7872><s%> age; <S%H7872><s%> They shall be full <S%H1879><s%> of sap <S%H1879><s%> and very <S%H7488><s%> green, <S%H7488><s%>
To declare <S%H5046><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is upright; <S%H3477><s%> [He is] my rock, <S%H6697><s%> and there is no <S%H3808><s%> unrighteousness <S%H9390><s%> in Him.
